org.apromore.plugin.provider

Interface PluginProvider


  • public interface PluginProvider
    Interfaces used by Apromore to retrieve all currently installed plugins. Implementations of this interface usually should use OSGi services (Gemini Blueprint) to pick up availables plugins automatically. Though it would also be possible to provide non-OSGi based implementations.
    Author:
    Felix Mannhardt (Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University oAS)
    See Also:
    "http://www.eclipse.org/gemini/blueprint/"

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Plugin findByName(String name) 
      Plugin findByNameAndVersion(String name, String version)

    • Method Detail

      • listAll

        Set<Plugin> listAll()
        Returns:
        read-only Set of all currently available plugins

      • listByType

        Set<Plugin> listByType(String type)
        Parameters:
        type - of the plugins
        Returns:
        read-only Set of all plugins with specified type

      • listByName

        Set<Plugin> listByName(String name)
        Parameters:
        name - of the plugins, usually the symbolic bundle name
        Returns:
        read-only Set of all plugins with specified name

      • findByName

        Plugin findByName(String name)
                  throws PluginNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        name - of the plugins, usually the symbolic bundle name
        Returns:
        plugin with specified name and highest version if multiple
        Throws:
        PluginNotFoundException - in case no matching Plugin is found

      • findByNameAndVersion

        Plugin findByNameAndVersion(String name,
                          String version)
                            throws PluginNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        name - of the plugins, usually the symbolic bundle name
        version - of the plugins, usually the bundle version (MAJOR.MINOR.MICRO.QUALIFIER)
        Returns:
        plugin with specified name and version
        Throws:
        PluginNotFoundException - in case no matching Plugin is found
